header.title: asn1rt

description.p: This module is the interface module for the ASN.1 runtime support functions. To encode and decode ASN.1 types in runtime the functions in this module should be used.

func.name: decode(Module,Type,Bytes) -> {ok,Value}|{error,Reason}
func.fsummary: Decode from bytes into an ASN.1 value.

desc.p: Decodes Type from Module from the binary Bytes. Returns {ok,Value} if successful.

Encodes Value of Type defined in the ASN.1 module Module. Returns a possibly nested list of bytes and or binaries if successful. To get as fast execution as possible the encode function only performs rudimentary tests that the input Value is a correct instance of Type. The length of strings is for example not always checked.

note.p: Starting in R16, Bytes is always a binary.

func.name: info(Module) -> {ok,Info} | {error,Reason}
func.fsummary: Returns compiler information about the Module.

desc.p: info/1 returns the version of the asn1 compiler that was used to compile the module. It also returns the compiler options that was used.

func.name: utf8_binary_to_list(UTF8Binary) -> {ok,UnicodeList} | {error,Reason}
func.fsummary: Transforms an utf8 encoded binary to a unicode list.

desc.p: utf8_binary_to_list/1 Transforms a UTF8 encoded binary to a list of integers, where each integer represents one character as its unicode value. The function fails if the binary is not a properly encoded UTF8 string.

func.name: utf8_list_to_binary(UnicodeList) -> {ok,UTF8Binary} | {error,Reason}
func.fsummary: Transforms an unicode list ot an utf8 binary.

desc.p: utf8_list_to_binary/1 Transforms a list of integers, where each integer represents one character as its unicode value, to a UTF8 encoded binary.
